headline: Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken with Bok Choy
description: This is a slow cooker version of a classic dish from the Philippines using chicken thighs, bok choy, apple cider vinegar, onion, and garlic.

video.name: Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken with Bok Choy

name: Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken with Bok Choy
recipeIngredient: 1 large head bok choy, cut into 1-inch strips

recipeInstructions.text: Combine onions, garlic, apple cider vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, and bay leaf in slow cooker. Season with black pepper. Place chicken thighs atop mixture. Sprinkle paprika over chicken thighs.
Cover and cook on Low for 8 hours.
Switch slow cooker to High. Add bok choy to chicken mixture; cook another 5 minutes. Garnish with green onion.

review.reviewBody: This one is a keeper. The only thing I changed was using boneless/skinless chicken thighs- they're a bit more expensive, but less fatty and easier to shred up once the recipe was one. The grocery store doesn't sell skinless bone-in thighs.
We didn’t really care for this recipe. I think the cool time was too long for the chicken and it was lacking flavor.

I added additional seasonings like tumeric, dry mustard, and cayenne pepper. Also Himalayan pink salt to give it more flavor, but otherwise a good recipe. The chicken was very flavorful. Reminded me of eating in the Philippines.

My family really enjoyed this dish. The chicken had the perfect flavor, and was so tender after spending the day in the crock pot! I made the recipe just as directed, did not change anything. Served with white rice. The only thing I might do different next time is increase the bok choy.
My husband and I found it very bland. It was good with Siracha. The two young boys liked and ate it fine, though.
I didn't have chicken thighs, so I used drumsticks and I only used one large onion and this turned out great!
This was delicious! The one change I made was to add a little red pepper flakes.
Super easy recipe to follow. I’m not eating onions so I used celery instead of onions and the dish tasted great. I thought it would be super hot with the paprika- this was not the case.

This was good! My whole family enjoyed it. I did take some other reviewers’ advice and only used 1/2 cup of the vinegar. I also used 1/2 cup of soy sauce instead of 1/3 and added an extra tablespoon of the brown sugar. I used LOTS of black pepper. I also used boneless thighs. My crockpot cooks super fast, so I only had to cook it 5 hours, until the chicken started to break apart. It has a nice tang, not too overpowering. It’s amazing the flavor with so few ingredients. Will make again.
Delicious

This was so easy to make! Everyone in my family loved this dish, including the teens, personally I found it a little salty but I don't think I would change anything. I used gai lan instead of bok choy so I left it in about 20 minutes instead of the 5 minutes for bok choy. Made brown rice to go with it.
I made it exactly according to the recipe and it was delicious. The only thing I’d do differently is to reduce the cooking time from 8 hours to 6.
Made exactly from recipe. Was very bland.
This is one very tasty meal. I love book choy in pretty much anything and this was one of the best ways. Have make it several times - even for guests. Love it.
It was awful and no I wouldn’t make it again.
Very good recipe! I used two TBL brown sugar to cut the acidity and I like more paprika so would double it in future or use a different blend than what I had on hand.
Loved it! Served it with an awesome citrus kale salad and cauliflower rice. Flavors complemented each other nicely. Easy meal and very satisfying.

I ran across this recipe and locked in on the bok choy ingredient which I had and really needed to cook or use in a salad. Score! All the other ingredients were on hand so it was destined to become dinner. Then discovered I only had 2 big fat thighs in the freezer. No problem, I could still pull this off, right? Then I realized my crock pot was on a shelf in the garage but the Instant Pot was handy. So I guessed at 1/4 of the seasonings except for using an entire large yellow onion. (I'm not a committed hard fast measurer). Also, went easy on the vinegar per other reviews. I filled the pot with onion and seasonings and set the thawed thighs on top with a full teaspoon of paprika sprinkled over them. I set the IP on Slow Cook and put a lid on it. After about 4 hours I opened the IP, added a full cup of long grain rice with about a half cup of water. Then changed the setting to Rice cooker. I had to run an errand and got back to the IP about 45 mins later. I was starved so spooned a healthy serving and let me tell you, this is delicious! Now, if I had only remembered to add the darn bok choy... Oh well, I can add the bok choy to the leftovers. :) Obviously, this recipe cannot be messed up, although I could have added less rice with only two thighs. I will make it many more times and especially for company!! Great sauce and great flavor.
Our family enjoyed it over rice. I thought it was just a bit tangy but no one else did. It was my first time using this recipe so I followed it without deviation. There were no leftovers!
I only used half a large purple onion, rice vinegar instead of apple cider and added 4 tbsp. of brown sugar. Turned out amazing!

I made this as written using boneless skinless chicken thighs., cooking it for 6 hours. I did not add the bock choy. I served it over rice. It was WONDERFUL! My hubby raved about it, and the sauce was very tasty. It seemed that the sweetness of the onions blended perfectly with the tang of the cider vinegar. I’ll gladly make this frequently.

This was good, but a little on the bland side. Used the 1/2 cup apply cider vinegar and 1/2 cup chicken broth option. Thought it was a little bland. Will try to spice up a little next time, maybe with some sweet red chili sauce.
Cut the vinegar by a 1/3 of a cup and came out perfect! Will make this again soon.
This was really good. I did tweak a few things. Doubled the brown sugar, added a cup of water, and only used 1/2 cup of vinegar.
my family loves adobo already and I like the option to add a new veggie!

I made this exactly as written, and everyone in my family really liked it. well, actually I did saute the garlic before putting it in the Crock-Pot. I find that raw garlic doesn't work in the Crock-Pot very well.
Easy and tastefull. Next time I will jazz it up with a little more spice
I forgot to put the paprika and bay leave in, it was still pretty tasty!

I thought this adobo recipe was just ok and don't know if Filipino Chicken Adobo is an ideal slow cooker recipe in general; or necessary as it doesn't take that long to cook it in a traditional way. This recipe also needed more garlic and bay leaves; and I recommend a 1/2 a tablespoon of whole black peppercorns. I'd also drop the onions. Any way...look up a traditional Filipino Adobo recipe where the meat is cooked in a rolling boil for about 45 minutes-1 hour and compare.
Followed the recipe as written except for using chicken breasts. It was just OK. Not crazy about the flavors. Probably. won't make it again.
Excellent! So gentle on the stomach and satisfying! A new slow cooker staple.

Did everything as stated except we used boneless chicken breasts. Since there were no bones in chicken I cooked for 4 hours instead of the 8. I wanted to toss it out, but hubby said he'd eat it this time, but he wished he hadn't later because the bok choy bloated both of us bad. We love bok choy salad, but not this way. The chicken didn't have much flavor, but the juice tasted fairly good over rice. Won't be making this again.
Followed the recipe and it was really good. The next day I felt it was missing something so I added a small amount of sugar to the leftovers before re-heating it...took it to a new level of tasty!
Really tender and tasty. I really recommend this recipe. Simple to prepare and little fuss.

I didn't have time to cook this for 8 hours so I cooked it on high for about 5, and only used 1/2 cup of vinegar because that's all I had. My golly, but this was tasty! I will be sure to make it again as written.
This was great as written. The vinegar made it tangy-- maybe it matters which vinegar you use (or personal taste). Great recipe that I'll be making again.
Store was out of Bok Choy so I had to use cabbage and I wanted to use white meat so I used chicken breasts instead and no onions because they make my nose itch??
I made this according to someone's suggestion below to cut the apple cider vinegar to half a cup and add half a cup of water. Great flavor, will definitely make it again.
The dish was too "vinegary" for us.
I didn't make any changes and it turned out to be really yummy.
I will not make again. I am not a fan of the sour, salty taste of this dish.
This was very good! I doubled sauce but not vinegar based on a few other reviews. I ended up adding almost the entire other half of the vinegar at the end of cooking. Served over white rice. Yummy!
i used a half of a small(tiny)chicken- a little over a pound- no bok choy-- baked at 325 about 40 minutes- hubs loved it for lunch

I did make one change. I used 1/3 cup cider vinegar and 1/3 cup rice wine vinegar. The rest I kept the same. It was delicious. I served over rice. I also used boneless chicken breasts and only cooked half the amount of time
Very tender and tasty, but I would recommend using boneless thighs....falls off the bone tender anyway!
Will not make this again. Awful!
Will not make this again. Awful!
Made it with the adjustment to the cider vinegar as other suggested. It was so good. Will definitely make again.
I don't like vinegar but thought it might be off-set by the soy sauce and brown sugar. It was not. Sorry to say I could not eat dish.
Took advise of others and used 1/2 cup of vinegar and remaining water. Followed recipe otherwise. Don't know if I would make again but it was edible. It did remind me how much I liked Bok Choy.
The chicken and the bok choy turned out perfectly. I will make it again, but probably with less vinegar.
I thought this was delicious. So quick and easy to make.

i do not like giving unfavorable reviews. This call for way to much vinegar,it overpowered the dish and i only used about 4 tbsp. there was no flavor to this dish. It basically 
is boiled chicken. I gave it two stars for ease.
Will not make again.
It was too salty. My son had only one bite. I reduced apple slider vinegar for half amount and add chicken broth like someone suggested.

I did mine with napa and chicken breast and reduced vinegar to a 1/2 cup. I did add some ginger root, sliced carrot, and sliced zuchinni with the napa at end. I served this over white rice and it's that sour sauce that comes through. Next time I will make this with chicken thighs.
I loved this recipe! Wasn’t to sour at all in my opinion it had just the right amount of twang. Definitely will make again and keep the recipe as is
Delicious recipe! The chicken falls right apart. Just make sure to use less of the vinegar and add more vegetables such as mushrooms or broccoli to make it more interesting. :)

What a delicious and comforting recipe! I put it in the crock pot before I left on Saturday morning to visit my mom and sister, returned home and put my feet up after adding the Bok Choy and starting some rice. When the food was ready, I removed the chicken to a platter, added some thickener to the broth and bok choy and then put everything out like a buffet. We all put rice in our bowls, ladled broth and bok choy over it and lay the chicken on top. I also put out soy sauce and red pepper flakes in case we wanted to add them to our individual dishes. It was so good we got stuffed!
I used legs. Review the comments -- most are useful in tweaking this dish.

Super easy. I didn't have apple cider vinegar so I just used rice vinegar and added 1/2 tablespoon brown sugar extra to try to make it a sweeter taste instead of too tangy. Chicken fell off the bones, good stuff!

Hard to believe with three steps I made a mistake, but I'm sure I did. In adding the bok choy at the end I put it on top of the chicken and it took a lot longer than 5 minutes to cook. I'm thinking I should have removed the chicken then added the bok choy and then put the chicken on top. Any thoughts on what I *should have* done?

I reduced the vinegar to 1/3 c based on other reviews. Used frozen bone in and skin on chicken thighs that were done at 4 hours on low in the crockpot. The sauce was a bit thin and greasy but boyfriend enjoyed the punchy hit of vinegar. I added boiled eggs for about half hour to steep in the marinade, made a nice additional component to this simple dish :)
I used white wine instead of vinegar and it was awesome. Had just enough bite to it but not as much as with vinegar. Did use on Bok Choy because I love it. Also served with white rice. Thanks.
This was really easy. It's good. Not spectacular but good. Better the next day. I used boneless thighs and cooked for a shorter time.
Only change I made to the recipe was replace brown sugar with splenda and used skinless chicken breast. I didn't have any thighs. Overall I thought it was good and would make it again.
I will definitely make it again but will us more bok choy.
Too much vinegar. Chicken fell apart and bones and gristle got served on the plate for an unpleasant surprise. Taste was good though.
I liked it. Wife thought it was too salty
This is a great, savoury chicken stew. Like most stews, it tastes even better on the second day when the flavours have been fully infused.
Definitely too much vinegar. I would reduce it and add chicken broth next time like the other reviewers suggest. Very tender chicken.

I used peppercorns, rather than ground black pepper, and omitted the bay leaf. I thought it was good, and my husband loved it (a surprise, since he rarely likes entrees with a sweet note). Another time, I would up the garlic.
Good paleo recipe. A couple of changes: used boneless thighs, substituted honey for the brown sugar, added mushrooms. Easy and tasty.
I followed the recipe but it was not that good. Chicken was dry and did not have much flavor.
Very easy and tasty. My husband loved it. I used low salt soy, so I added a bit more. I did not need 8 hours. I made 4 thighs and 5 hours was perfect. Fell right off the bone, but not mushy
No changes first time through, except I used boneless chicken breasts. Super easy and healthy. Everyone liked it as is, over brown rice. The onions are delicious. It's tangy, but not overwhelming.

I made this a few weeks ago. But cut down on the vinegar. I really liked it. Especially the crispness of the bok chop. Am going to make it today, but plan on using Ponzi Sauce instead of soy sauce and the correct amount of vinegar. Will check back.

Left the skin on the thighs, ommitted the brown sugar, otherwise followed the recipe. Thighs were done (overdone) after only 5 1/2 hours. Kinda mushy. Not enough liquid, meat was sitting on a rack of onions above the seasoning liquid, was nearly tasteless. Plus side, smelled good while cooking, wasn't vinegary, I used Apple cider vinegar and the Bok Choy was a great addition. Adobo is like chili, there's as many variations as there are cooks, think I'll stick to stovetop versions but thanks for the recipe.
it was delicious I used red wine vinegar
Very important. Do NOT over cook.
Did not taste like adobo at all, and I know how that tastes. I followed the recipe exactly. Nothing about this was worth the 8 hour wait.

I didn't make any changes. I thought it was a little too tangy and didn't have much depth of flavor. No Umami. Maybe some ginger should be added or a little heat but I will not make it again. Of course the meat is tender-it was cooked in a crockpot for 8 hours! You can't give it 5 stars just because the meat is tender.
Tasted okay but nothing special. Will not make again
So yummy and easy! Was a different flavor from the usual crockpot chicken. Made exactly as written, and wouldn't change a thing! Will make this again. Crowd pleasing!

Made this with a couple of changes. Instead of waiting 8 hours, I seasoned the thighs with adobo seasoning, let those sit while I did the prep work on the onions and garlic. Then I sauteed the thighs for 3 minutes per side in 2 batches. I had my pressure/slow cooker on "Keep Warm" so I tossed those in as they finished. 

Then I sauteed the onion and garlic in the skillet used for the chicken. After 5 minutes, I threw in 1/2 cup red wine to deglaze the pan and poured all that into the cooker. Set the pressure cooker to low pressure for 20 minutes.

When time was up, I vented and set it to slow cook for 30 minutes, added the bok choy and returned the cover with the vent open. After 30 minutes the thickest parts of the bok choy were not cooked so I turned it to saute until they looked cooked through.

It was very good and not bitter. I did made some changes. I my slow cooker (made of ceramic) I sprayed olive oil on the sides/bottom, then placed 1 tbsp of unsalted butter. place slow cooker at buffet till butter melted. then added the sweet onions, then garlic. Changed temp. to simmer. After 40mins., added a little bit of white wine. while that is simmering, I prepared the chicken smothered with paprika and pepper. Then prepared the veggies (added 2 Leeks) and then the sauce. Changed the temp. to low for 5-6. I did every 2 hours checked and/or mix it. I made steamed 3-rices (Brown/Jasmine/Balsamic).
Ok, not great tasting. Won't make it again.
Good, simple dish. Recommend a low sodium soy sauce.

Delicious - just finished a second helping. I used boneless thighs, smoked paprika, baby bok choy, and a little less brown sugar.

Will make again.
I had to use red wine vinegar since my fiancé cant eat apples. not sure if it made a difference.. I did like it though.. so I think its a 4 star
I found it to be on the bland side. I will make this again but with more vinegar and seasonings.
It was a little bland so we added scrambled eggs and hot sauce. Tasted amazing after that!
This was just okay in our books.
Very easy and good recipe. I did put it over rice which was even better with the extra sauce. It would be better with extra Bok Choy-I made it with boneless chicken thighs and it was great.
Made this recipe exactly as written, and all you could taste was the vinegar. it was super bitter tasting even though it was apple cider vinegar. I will not be making this again.
Meat did fall off the bone and the bok choy turned out well but overall we found this sour tasting and not worth making again.
My granddaughter and I both loved this. So easy and so yummy. Bok choy is one of my favorite vegetables so I have been using it a lot and this recipe did not disappoint!

Made this for a week of lunches last week, and it was a really big hit with my boyfriend. We actually used the remaining liquid from the slow cooker to make some rice with to help fill out the lunches, and it was an excellent way to eat each day.
The vinegar was too strong for me. Decreasing the vinegar and increasing the sugar might help but I wont make it again.

Followed the recipe to the letter EXCEPT used boneless skinless thighs. Will cut down the time a little next time with boneless and up it to the recipe for bone in. This was a fantastic meal. DH really loved it and we will make this one again.

item.name: Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken with Bok Choy
